intro: Silphium incisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have distinct teeth, contributing to its common name. Silphium incisum produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators.
